Uses of Class
Enemy

    • Uses of Enemy in <Unnamed>

      Subclasses of Enemy in <Unnamed> 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Boss
      The Boss class represents the final enemy which the Hero can defeat with all of the same abilities as the Hero.
      class  FireEnemy
      The FireEnemy class represents an Enemy with the Fireball projectile which the Player can defeat.
      class  GrassEnemy
      The GrassEnemy class represents an Enemy with the Leaf Dash move which the Player can defeat.
      class  WaterEnemy
      The WaterEnemy class represents an Enemy which can create a Waterfall which the Player can defeat.

      Check collision with enemy
      void Hero.checkEnemyCollision(Enemy e1)
      Makes the Hero lose a heart and jump up if it collides with an enemy.
      void Hero.punch(Enemy e1)
      Deals damage to an enemy by punching it.
      Method parameters in <Unnamed> with type arguments of type Enemy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Hero.act(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> platforms, java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> enemies, java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokens, java.util.ArrayList<Spike> spikes, java.util.ArrayList<MovingPlatform> movingPlatforms)
      Makes the Hero act by moving, being affected by gravity and friction, and get hurt if attacked by enemy.
      void Hero.dash(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> platforms, java.util.ArrayList<MovingPlatform> movingPlatforms, java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> enemies)
      Makes the Hero dash depending on the direction which the Hero is facing and how long it is charged.
